LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionInitial: RimWorld has been updated from version {0} to version {1}.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSavesIncompatible: This may cause saved games and mods from the old version to stop working.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSavesCompatible: Saved games from the old version should be compatible, however some mods may stop working.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionNonSteam: Since this is a DRM-free copy, you can install the game twice in two different folders, to be able to play both old and new versions.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSteam:
If you wish to continue with the old version, you can opt in using Steam's "Betas" feature.

 1. In the Steam library, right-click RimWorld.
 2. Click Properties.
 3. Click the Betas tab.
 4. Select the version you want from the drop-down menu.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSteamController: If you wish to continue with the old version, you can opt in using Steam's "Betas" feature.
LanguageData.RecoveredFromErrorsDialogTitle: Recovered from incompatible or corrupted mods errors
LanguageData.RecoveredFromErrorsText:
It seems that some of the active mods were causing errors.

They were incompatible with each other, designed for a different version of RimWorld, or corrupted.

All mods have been disabled and can be activated again in the mods dialog.
LanguageData.ErrorWhileLoadingAssets: An error occurred while loading game assets. See error log for more information.
LanguageData.ErrorWhileLoadingAssets_ModsInfo: The game is currently running with custom mods - they may or may not cause these problems.
LanguageData.ErrorWhileGeneratingMap: An error occurred while generating a new map. See error log for more information.
LanguageData.ErrorWhileLoadingMap: An error occurred while loading a map. See error log for more information.
LanguageData.ModsChanged: The mod list has changed. The game will now restart automatically.
LanguageData.FailedToRestart: Something went wrong while restarting the game. The game can't fully unload modified code from deactivated mods, so code from deactivated mods may still be active.\n\nIt's recommended that you quit and restart the game now to load all mods cleanly.
LanguageData.SteamClientMissing:
Could not initialize Steam API. Possible causes:

-Steam is not running.
-Launched from outside Steam without steam_appid.txt in place.
-Running with different privileges than Steam client (e.g. "as administrator").

In most cases, rebooting your computer will fix this problem.

You can play anyway, but no Steam stats will be recorded and Steam features won't be available.
LanguageData.SaveIsFromDifferentGameVersion: We are running version {0} but the save data is from {1}, which is a different version entirely.\n\nTrying to load this data will probably not work.
LanguageData.SaveIsFromDifferentGameBuild: We are running version {0} but the save data is from {1}, which is a different build.\n\nTrying to load this data should still work.
LanguageData.SaveIsFromThisGameBuild: Save data was saved with our game version and should work without issue.
LanguageData.SaveIsUnknownFormat: Save data is in an unknown format and almost certainly will not load properly.
LanguageData.MissingMods: Some mods are unavailable, and need to be installed
LanguageData.NamePlayerFactionMessage: Since it looks like you'll be here for a while, {0} thinks that you should give your faction a name. What should your faction be called?
LanguageData.PlayerFactionGainsName: Your faction is now known as {0}.
LanguageData.NamePlayerFactionBaseMessage: {0} thinks that you should give this settlement a name. What should the local settlement be called?
LanguageData.PlayerFactionBaseGainsName: This community is now known as {0}.
LanguageData.NamePlayerFactionBaseMessage_NameFaction: {0} also thinks that you should give this settlement a name. What should this local settlement be called?
LanguageData.PlayerFactionAndBaseGainsName: Your faction is now known as {0}, and this community is now known as {1}.
LanguageData.PawnGainsName: This person's nickname is now {0}. {PAWN_possessive} title is {PAWN_title}.
LanguageData.ModsMismatchWarningText: This file was saved with a different set of mods active than those we are currently running. This may or may not cause problems, depending on exactly what these mods do.
LanguageData.ModsMismatchOrderChanged: No mods have been added or removed, but the order of your mod list has changed.
LanguageData.ConfirmLoadSaveList: Are you sure you want to load the mod list from this save file?
LanguageData.ConfirmResolutionChange: You've changed your screen settings. Do the new ones work okay?\n\nAuto-reverting in {0}...
LanguageData.ConfirmPermanentlyDisableDevMode:
Do you really want to permanently disable development mode on this computer?

This option is for people who want a pure play experience without the temptation to use development tools to gain advantage in normal play.

Development mode can be re-enabled, but doing so requires manually editing configuration files. You'll need to search the Internet to find out how.
LanguageData.ConfirmResetLearningHelper: Are you sure you want to reset the learning helper?\n\nAll records of which concepts have been learned will be erased and the system will teach everything from scratch.
LanguageData.RestartAfterImportingLegacyBackstoryTans: Backstories are now implemented as a def and all legacy backstory translations have been imported into def translations. The file {0} has been imported and moved to {1}. It can now be deleted.\n\nRestart the game for changes to take effect.
LanguageData.MapWinterWarning: Warning: You will be landing in winter. It may be hard or nearly impossible to survive. If you are not intending to face an extreme challenge, choose a different season.
LanguageData.MapSizePerformanceWarning: The game is designed to play on medium map sizes. These sizes provide plenty of space!\n\nLarge map sizes don't just degrade performance - they actually break the game design. The AI will make stupid decisions, and game balance will be badly affected in various ways. These sizes are included for tradition and testing reasons only, please do not use them without a specific reason.
LanguageData.RecipeCannotHaveTargetCount: (This recipe cannot have a target count because it has multiple or unpredictable products.)
LanguageData.BillRequiresMayVary: Note: Small-volume ingredients like gold require {0}x as much.
LanguageData.ThisIsSmallVolume: This is a small-volume ingredient. This means that each 'unit' is only 1/{0} as much as a normal-volume ingredient. So, to fill the same ingredient requirement, you'll need {0}x as much as usual.
LanguageData.ArmorPenetrationExplanation: Armor penetration is the amount of armor this weapon will ignore each time it hits the target.\n\nIf armor penetration is greater than the target's armor, it is as though the target is unarmored. Otherwise, the armor penetration is subtracted from the target's armor.
LanguageData.BuildingDamageFactorExplanation: Damage to all buildings is multiplied by this value.
LanguageData.BuildingDamageFactorImpassableExplanatio: Damage to all impassable buildings is multiplied by this value.
LanguageData.BuildingDamageFactorPassableExplanation: Damage to all passable buildings is multiplied by this value.
LanguageData.StoppingPowerExplanation: Hits from this weapon will stagger targets, slowing their movement for several seconds.\n\nTargets with a body size larger than the stopping power will be unaffected.
LanguageData.GrowingTimeDesc:
Plants only grow for part of the day, and only when lit.

This statistic measures the time the plant needs to spend actually growing to reach full size.

The actual real growing time will generally be about twice as long.
Low temperatures also slow plant growth.
LanguageData.CoverEffectivenessExplanation: How effective this is when used as cover in a gunfight.\n\nHigher percentages will block more shots.
LanguageData.WildnessExplanation: Wilder creatures are naturally more difficult to tame, train, and handle.
LanguageData.TamenessWillNotDecay: Tameness will never decay for animals of very low wildness.
LanguageData.TamenessWillNotDecayFenceBlocked: Tameness will never decay for animals that can be kept behind fences.
LanguageData.PackAnimalExplanation: Whether this animal is appropriate to use to carry items in a caravan over long distances.
LanguageData.SkillRequiredToBuildExplanation: Requires this level of {0} in order to build.
LanguageData.NuzzleIntervalExplanation:
How often an animal will nuzzle friendly colonists, on average.

Nuzzling is a behavior shared by many animal species, where the animal presses its nose or muzzle against a friend as a sign of affection.
Most humans find this cute and it will leave them in a good mood for a period of time.
LanguageData.HarmedRevengeChanceExplanation:
The chance this creature will attack when harmed.

This chance increases up to three times if the attacker is closer.

This chance is applied each time damage is taken. This means that slower-firing, higher-damage weapons are less likely to trigger it while hunting.
LanguageData.RearmCostExplanation: Resources needed to rearm this turret
LanguageData.ShotsBeforeRearmExplanation: How many shots this turret can fire before it has to be rearmed.
LanguageData.AbilityTargetDesc: The types of targets on which this ability can be used.
LanguageData.MeditationFocusesPawnDesc: The types of meditation focus this person can use. When meditating, a person can focus on an object to boost their psyfocus gain - but only if that object offers a focus type they can use. Each person's meditation types are determined by their background, traits, social position, and so on.
LanguageData.MeditationFocusesDesc: The types of meditation focus this object offers. A meditating person can focus on this object to boost their psyfocus gain, but only if they are able to use one of its meditation types. Each person can use different meditation types depending on their background, traits, social position, and so on.
LanguageData.BuyPriceDesc: Price you pay to buy this.
LanguageData.SellPriceDesc: Price you receive for selling this.
LanguageData.PriceTypeDesc: For this item, this price is {0}.
LanguageData.ColonyCount: How many of this item the colony has ready to trade.\n\nYou can only sell items to orbital traders if they are near an orbital trade beacon.
LanguageData.TraderCount: How many of this item the trader has to trade.
LanguageData.YourTradeableSilverTip: You can only trade with silver that is near an orbital trade beacon and not under a roof.
LanguageData.TraderWillNotTrade: Trader is not willing to buy this.
LanguageData.NegotiatorTalkingImpaired: Your negotiator {1_labelShort} cannot talk properly because of poor health.
LanguageData.NegotiatorHearingImpaired: Your negotiator {1_labelShort} cannot hear properly because of poor health.
LanguageData.NegotiatorCapacityImpaired: This will affect trade prices.\n\nConsider using a healthier negotiator.
LanguageData.ConfirmTraderShortFunds: Trader has insufficient silver to fully cover this transaction. Proceed anyways?
LanguageData.JoinsAsSlaveDesc: If purchased, this person will join your colony as a slave.
LanguageData.JoinsAsColonistDesc: If purchased, this person will join your colony as a colonist.
LanguageData.TradeCaravanRequestDeniedDueTitle: {FACTION_name} is not willing to send a caravan because {NEGOTIATOR_nameDef} lacks the required title of {TITLE}.
LanguageData.OrbitalTradeRequestDeniedDueTitle: {FACTION_name} is not willing to send an orbital trader because {NEGOTIATOR_nameDef} lacks the required title of {TITLE}.
LanguageData.FormCaravanColonyThingCountTip: Number available to send with the caravan.
LanguageData.CaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneColonist: You must assign at least one non-downed colonist.
LanguageData.CaravanCouldNotFindExitSpot: The chosen exit location ({0}) is inaccessible.
LanguageData.CaravanCouldNotFindPackingSpot: Could not find any valid packing spot. Make sure that the chosen exit location ({0}) is accessible.
LanguageData.CaravanCouldNotFindReachableExitSpot: Warning: Some of the assigned colonists are unable to reach the exit location ({0}).
LanguageData.CaravanRoamerCannotReachSpots: {1_labelShort} is unable to reach the packing spot or the exit location when led by any of the assigned colonists.
LanguageData.CaravanItemIsUnreachableSingle: None of the assigned colonists are able to reach the {0}.
LanguageData.CaravanItemIsUnreachableMulti: None of the assigned colonists are able to reach {0}x {1}.
LanguageData.TooBigCaravanMassUsage: The caravan can't carry that much.
LanguageData.CaravanMassUsageTooltip: Includes carried items and equipped items. Carrying less than the maximum gives a speed bonus.
LanguageData.CaravanVisibilityTip:
Visibility is how easy your caravan is to notice.

It multiplies the chance that your caravan will be waylaid by enemies.

Visibility does not affect your ability to find things you want.

Visibility is based on the total body size of all people and animals in the caravan.
LanguageData.DaysWorthOfFoodTooltip:
The approximate number of days before at least one person or animal will be out of food. Different species have different diets, so one may run out of food before others. This value is calculated more accurately after the route is chosen.

Affected by:
 - Current pawn inventory
 - Carried food type and amount
 - Caravan members and their diets
 - Foraging rate
 - Whether animals can graze
 - Time until food rots
 - Hot weather rots food faster
LanguageData.DaysWorthOfFoodTooltip_OnlyFirstWaypoint: (only the first waypoint is taken into account)
LanguageData.DaysWorthOfFoodWarningDialog: Your caravan only has {0} days worth of food and will become hungry quickly.
LanguageData.DaysWorthOfFoodDietWarningDialog: Some peoples' diets don't allow most of the food in your caravan. If they're forced to eat it due to hunger, they will become unhappy.
LanguageData.DaysWorthOfFoodWarningDialog_NoFood: Your caravan has no food and will become hungry very quickly.
LanguageData.ForagedFoodPerDayTip: The average amount of food per day your people will forage. This value will change as you travel across biomes with different forage yield rates.
LanguageData.CaravanFoodWillRotSoonWarningDialog: A large part of the caravan's food will rot soon.
LanguageData.CaravanIncapableOfSocial: You have no caravan members capable of diplomacy or trading.
LanguageData.CaravanAreYouSure: Are you sure you want to form this caravan?
LanguageData.MessageMustChooseRouteFirst: You must choose a route for the caravan first.
LanguageData.MessageNoValidExitTile: Your caravan is unable to leave the area. Make sure that at least one side is reachable.
LanguageData.DaysUntilRotTip: The number of days until this item starts to rot based on the average temperature in this area.
LanguageData.ItemNutritionTip: How much nutrition this food provides.\n\nFor reference: adult person needs {0} nutrition per day.
LanguageData.AnimalCanGrazeTip: This animal can graze food from the environment instead of eating carried food. Grazing is only possible in some biomes and temperature ranges.
LanguageData.NutritionForagedPerDayTip: Nutrition foraged per day. The actual amount foraged is also affected by biome forageability.\n\n{0}
LanguageData.NutritionEatenPerDayTip: Nutrition eaten per day. For reference, simple meals have {0} nutrition.
LanguageData.CaravanFormationProcessStarted: Your colonists will now gather the items and leave the area.
LanguageData.CaravanMovementSpeedTip: Movement speed depends on carried mass, ridden animals, and terrain movement difficulty.
LanguageData.AnimalsWillBeAbleToGraze: Animals will be able to graze
LanguageData.CaravanAnimalSick: This animal is sick. It is suffering from the following illnesses
LanguageData.SourceCaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneColonist: You must leave at least one non-downed colonist.
LanguageData.SplitCaravanThingCountTip: How many of this item the caravan has ready to give to the new caravan.
LanguageData.ConfirmAttackFriendlyFaction: Are you sure you want to attack {0}?\n\nThis will make {1} hostile to you, and they will eventually start raiding your colony!
LanguageData.TooBigTransportersMassUsage: The assigned people and items are too heavy for the transport pods.
LanguageData.TooBigTransporterSingleMassUsage: The assigned people and items are too heavy for the shuttle.
LanguageData.CantSendEmptyTransportPods: You can't send empty transport pods.
LanguageData.TransporterItemIsUnreachableSingle: There is no path between the transport pods and the {0}.
LanguageData.TransporterSingleItemIsUnreachableSingle: There is no path between the shuttle and the {0}.
LanguageData.TransporterItemIsUnreachableMulti: There is no path between the transport pods and {0}x {1}.
LanguageData.TransporterSingleItemIsUnreachableMulti: There is no path between the shuttle and {0}x {1}.
LanguageData.ResearchUnknownProjectRevealed: By researching {0} you have discovered the {1} research project.
LanguageData.HistoryUploadMessage: Do you want to upload your gameplay data records to RimWorld server in order to help developers balance the game? If you agree, your data will be uploaded every {0} days (and in some other rare cases like the end of the game). Privacy preferences can be changed later in the options menu.
LanguageData.HistoryUploadMessagePlayerName: Even though history is sent anonymously, you can attach your name.
LanguageData.HistoryUploadNo: Do not allow uploading gameplay data
LanguageData.HistoryUploadNoOnce: Do not upload this time, ask me later
LanguageData.DuplicatePolicyTip: Create a duplicate of the selected policy.
LanguageData.DefaultPolicyTip: Make this policy the default policy given to new colonists.
LanguageData.DeletePolicyConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the policy: {0}?
LanguageData.ApparelPolicyTip: Create and manage templates for controlling what apparel items colony members can wear.
LanguageData.OutfitInUse: Apparel policy is in use by {0}.
LanguageData.DrugPolicyTip: Create and manage templates for controlling which drugs your colonists are allowed to consume.
LanguageData.DrugPolicyInUse: Drugs policy is in use by {0}.
LanguageData.FoodRestrictionInUse: Food restriction is in use by {0}.
LanguageData.FrequencyColumnDesc: How often the colonists should try to take this drug.
LanguageData.MoodThresholdColumnDesc: The colonists will take this drug only if their mood level is below this threshold.
LanguageData.JoyThresholdColumnDesc: The colonists will take this drug only if their recreation level is below this threshold.
LanguageData.TakeToInventoryColumnDesc: An amount of the drug to pick up extra when gathering it for consumption, in order to avoid having to visit the drug stockpile every time.
LanguageData.DrugUsageTipForAddiction:
For addictions

Use this drug to feed already-established addiction needs.

Even if disabled, some characters with specific traits, or on mental breaks, may use the drug anyway.
LanguageData.DrugUsageTipForJoy:
For recreation

Use this drug for recreation and social purposes.

Even if disabled, some characters with specific traits, or on mental breaks, may use the drug anyway.
LanguageData.DrugUsageTipScheduled: Scheduled\n\nUse this drug on a defined schedule, when specific conditions are met.
LanguageData.FoodPolicyTip: Create and manage templates for controlling what food items colony members can eat.
LanguageData.ReadingPolicyTip: Create and manage templates for controlling which books colony members are allowed to read.
LanguageData.DefaultMedicineSettingsDesc: These medical settings are assigned to creatures when they first join a given group. You can manually assign a setting to an individual in their health tab.\n\nNote: If the creature joins a new group, they will always take the settings of that group, even if you previously assigned them a setting.
LanguageData.MedGroupPrisonersDesc: Prisoners in your colony, regardless of faction.
LanguageData.MedGroupTamedAnimalsDesc: Animals which have been tamed by your colony.
LanguageData.MedGroupFriendlyFactionDesc: Humans or animals who are part of a faction which is friendly with your faction (goodwill above 75).
LanguageData.MedGroupNeutralFactionDesc: Humans or animals who are part of a faction which is neutral with your faction (between -75 and 75 goodwill).
LanguageData.MedGroupHostileFactionDesc: Humans or animals who are part of a faction which is hostile with your faction (goodwill below -75).
LanguageData.MedGroupNoFactionDesc: Humans who are not members of any faction.
LanguageData.MedGroupWildlifeDesc: Animals and other creatures which are not members of any faction.
LanguageData.NoGrowerCanPlant: {0} requires {1} skill in Growing to sow.\n\nNone of your non-downed growers have this skill, so this plant will not be sown.
LanguageData.ConfirmAbandonHomeNegativeThoughts: Abandoning {0} will cause the following people to get the following thoughts:
LanguageData.ConfirmMoveAutoJoinableCaravan:
Some animals or prisoners are trying to join this caravan. If you move it, they won't be able to anymore.

Animals, prisoners, and downed colonists left behind in a map without any non-downed colonists are considered abandoned and can be captured by the enemies.

Are you sure you want to move your caravan?
LanguageData.ConfirmBanishPawnDialog: Do you really want to banish {1_label}?
LanguageData.ConfirmBanishPawnDialog_Items: {1_labelShort} will take the following items with {1_objective}:
LanguageData.ConfirmBanishPawnDialog_AllColonistsThou: All colonists will get the following thoughts:
LanguageData.ConfirmBanishPawnDialog_IndividualThough: Banishing {1_labelShort} will cause the following people to get the following thoughts:
LanguageData.ConfirmSendNotCompletelyLoadedLaunchable: The following still need to be loaded
LanguageData.ConfirmSettleNearFactionBase: Since this location is within {0} tiles of another faction base, they will feel you are encroaching on their land and relations with those factions will worsen every {1} days.
LanguageData.ConfirmCleanupTranslationFiles:
Are you sure you want to cleanup all translation files for language {0}?

This will:
 - Add placeholders for missing keyed translations, def-injected translations, and backstories
 - Add or update comments containing the original, untranslated text
 - Move all keyed and def-injected translations to the appropriate XML files
 - Apply automatic formatting to all XML files
 - Update back-compatible def names
 - Remove all existing XML comments (except in full-list injections)

Non-XML files will not be removed or modified.

Remember to restart the game after modifying the language files before running this tool in order to reload all data.

Make sure to back up all translation files before using this tool.
LanguageData.TransportersCaravanWillBeImmobile: The caravan will be immobile if you launch to an empty tile. Continue anyway?
LanguageData.ConfirmCancelMonumentMarker: Do you really want to remove this monument marker?
LanguageData.AbilityCannotHitTarget: No line of sight to target.
LanguageData.AbilityCantApplyToScaria: {0_labelShort} has scaria, which can only be treated medically.
LanguageData.AbilityDoesntWorkOnMentalState: {0} doesn't work on the '{1}' mental state.
LanguageData.PsyfocusCostPerMentalBreakIntensity: Psyfocus cost per mental break intensity
LanguageData.AbilityCantGetInspiredNow: {0_labelShort} can't get an inspiration right now.
LanguageData.AbilityMustBeNotSameIdeo: {0_labelShort} must be of a different ideoligion than {1_labelShort}.
LanguageData.AbilityMustBeSameIdeo: {0_labelShort} must be of same ideoligion as {1_labelShort}.
LanguageData.AbilityNeedAllyToSkip: Need ally at target for navigation
LanguageData.FarskipConfirmTeleportingLodger: If you skip {PAWN_labelShort} to another map or a caravan, the associated quest will fail and {PAWN_pronoun} will leave immediately.\n\nDo you really want to farskip {PAWN_labelShort}?
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherTip: Colonists first slaughter non-pregnant animals in order from oldest to youngest, then pregnant animals from most recent to least recent pregnancy.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipLabel: The animal to be automatically slaughtered.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipCurrentTotal: The current number of animals in the colony, both male and female.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipMaxTotal: The maximum number of animals in the colony, both male and female.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipCurrentMales: The current number of males of breeding age in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipCurrentMalesYo: The current number of baby and juvenile males in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipMaxMales: The maximum number of males of breeding age in the colony.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipMaxMalesYoung: The maximum number of baby and juvenile males in the colony.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipCurrentFemales: The current number of females of breeding age in the colony.
The current number of baby and juvenile females in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipMaxFemales: The maximum number of females in the colony.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipMaxFemalesYoun: The maximum number of baby and juvenile females in the colony.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipCurrentPregnan: The current number of pregnant animals in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipAllowSlaughter: Allow pregnant animals to be slaughtered along with other females of the same species.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipCurrentBonded: The current number of bonded animals in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipAllowSlaughter: Allow bonded animals to be slaughtered.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterTooltipSetLimit: Click to set an animal count limit.
LanguageData.TooltipDyeExplanation: Dye can be farmed from tinctoria or purchased from traders.
LanguageData.CommandCopyColorDesc: Copy the current color to the clipboard.
LanguageData.CommandPasteColorDesc: Overwrite the color with the color in the clipboard.
LanguageData.ClipboardInvalidColor: The clipboard does not contain a valid color.
LanguageData.ToggleDarklightOffDesc: Change the light color to its normal color.
LanguageData.ToggleDarklightOnDesc: Change the light color to darklight.
LanguageData.ColorTemperatureTooltip: Choose a color by setting the color temperature. Note: This only affects visual color, not heat output.
LanguageData.SearchTheMapDesc: Search the current map for items, buildings, people, animals, plants, and more.
LanguageData.SearchTheWorldDesc: Search the world for specific features, landmarks, quests, or settlements.
